alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Broward County through 300 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Miccosukee Service Plaza to near Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
